Job Title: C#/ .NET DeveloperLocation: Karachi (Night Shift)Job Type: Onsite/PermanentJob Summary:We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated C#/. NET Developer to join our software development team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business applications using Microsoft technologies. You will work closely with the project manager and cross-functional teams to build scalable, high-quality, and performance-driven solutions. Key Responsibilities:* Design, develop, and maintain robust business applications using C#, . NET (Core/Framework). * Collaborate with project managers, analysts, and other developers to define software requirements and deliver technical solutions. * Write clean, scalable, and efficient code following best practices and coding standards. * Integrate third-party APIs and data sources into applications. * Debug and resolve technical issues reported by QA or end-users. * Participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation. * Maintain version control and deployment pipelines (e. g. , Git, Azure DevOps). * Ensure security, performance, and responsiveness of applications. * Keep up-to-date with the latest technologies and suggest improvements. Nice to Have:* Experience working on ERP, CRM, or other business management applications. * Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies. * Knowledge of Blazor, SignalR, or other advanced . How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.
